quest.name: The Last Bastion
journal: Jullus knows only too well that danger lurks around every corner.
objectives: Go with Jullus and defeat the tempered soldiers.
Go with Jullus and defeat the tempered soldiers.
Go with Jullus and defeat the tempered soldiers.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We're getting closer to the imperial palace...if one can still call it that. It truly is a terrifying sight to behold...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I wonder what sort of conditions Jullus and his comrades are living in. If they've any sense, they'll have picked somewhere like Victors' Spoils to take shelter.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: From here, we'll be heading northeast, keeping to the left of the railway.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: While the route itself is straightforward, getting past the hordes unseen is anything but. Keep your weapons at the ready.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They would attack their own countrymen?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Aye. They spare their own but slaughter the rest without hesitation.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Though we'll try to avoid detection, the chances of sneaking by completely unnoticed are slim at best. I will lead the way, but in the event we are seen...you're to fight them off.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Those two will follow us, provided they can refrain from drawing their weapons. While I doubt they would be foolish enough to stab their guide in the back, I will not take that chance. With that said, let us proceed...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Glory...to Garlemald...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Death...to her enemies...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must stay alert...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, we're perfectly capable of holding our own...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I see why your comrades chose you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Jullus, our contingent has a cure for the afflicted, or “tempered” as we call them.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Your people would need to be taken into custody that we may administer the treatment, but they would eventually regain their sanity.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Is that so? For all I know, your “treatment” would simply force them to forsake one master for another.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: As far as I and my legion are concerned, they are no longer our people. They're beyond saving.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Those who thought differently and tried to reason with them were butchered for their bleeding hearts. Come─we have to keep moving.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Long live...the Emperor...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I hate to watch you bear this burden alone...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Looks like we're not being followed. We will continue onward.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The surest way to limit casualties is to reach our destination without drawing attention to ourselves. Perhaps afterwards we can try again to convince Jullus that the tempered can be saved...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: He truly believes there's nothing that can be done for them. No wonder he isn't afraid to get his hands dirty...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: ...I meant what I said─these “people” deserve only death. I stayed my hand before only out of a desire to remain undiscovered, and that is still the higher priority. We should continue to avoid any unnecessary confrontations.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Keep following the railway.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Aaahhh...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Unnnghhh...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Such a transformation is likely irreversible...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: To think they were once ordinary people...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Look at what they have become. Would you still stand there and claim that they can be cured!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Those exposed to a vast quantity of a primal's aether may suffer severe corruption...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Even with treatment, such victims are beyond salvation.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Then you admit it. Now that you have seen these monstrosities for yourself, perhaps you will think twice before speaking of a cure.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though I wish there was another way, I thank you for keeping us from harm.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Even here in the outskirts, it's plain to see how vastly different Garlemald is compared to other cities...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: We're almost there.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: You have kept your side of the agreement, so I will keep mine. This way.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Seems secure enough, but hardly the most hospitable of places.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: This is Tertium, one of Garlemald's largest stations. It now serves as our headquarters.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I've already sent the twins ahead. I will be with you soon, so wait for me at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Go on, down the stairs, like I told you.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Or is this your first time into an underground station? They're all over Garlemald. Even during severe blizzards, we could use them to travel from one end of the city to another. Back when they were still in operation, that is.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I had no idea they had such expansive structures built underground...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It's plain to see why they chose this as their base of operations.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: They could have done a lot worse. Even so, I imagine it's not the easiest place to live.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed...and if Jullus was willing to make the perilous journey to Camp Broken Glass in search of food, their own supplies must be all but exhausted.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They may be shielded from the wind and snow, but it's still bitterly cold. Much like Victors' Spoils, it must be a constant struggle to keep their people warm.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Lower your voices. While you may be here as my “guests,” the others will not take kindly to your presence.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: My commander is in the locomotive, over there.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Now comes the true test...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: He certainly looks the part...

dialogue.name: QUINTUS
dialogue.text: I will deal with you in a moment.
